title: Met Police Officer Fired For Misogynistic Group Chat Suggesting Violence Against Women
summary: A Met Police officer was fired for participating in a misogynistic group chat with other officers, which included inappropriate and offensive messages about women. The panel noted the messages continued despite public scrutiny of police culture following Sarah Everard's murder. The officer admitted gross misconduct, but two other officers denied their messages were grossly offensive. The panel found the opposition to the messages was not sufficient and the officers showed a lack of responsibility.

title: Boy, 17, Shot In Croydon Street Attack As Met Police Hunt Gunman
summary: A 17-year-old boy was shot and injured in Croydon, London. The incident occurred on February 10, 2023, near the junction of High Street and Park Street. The victim's condition is potentially life-changing. No arrests have been made. Witnesses report frequent violent incidents in the area.

title: London Heathrow To Get Upgraded Terminals In Multi-Billion Pound Investment Ahead Of New Runway Plan
summary: Heathrow airport in Hillingdon is set to announce a multi-billion pound investment for upgrades and expansion, including terminal capacity increases, airfield layout reconfiguration, and transportation improvements. This comes in preparation for a new runway proposal and is expected to boost UK investment and economic growth. Heathrow aims to carry out the project responsibly with strict environmental safeguards.

title: Arsenal'S Kelly Left Out Of England'S Nations League Squad
summary: Chloe Kelly has been left out of England's Women's Nations League squad due to not playing enough for her new club Arsenal. Lauren James, Ella Toone, and Nikita Parris have been called up. Georgia Stanway is out due to injury. The squad includes players from various WSL teams.

title: Chelsea Striker Kerr Cleared Of Racial Harassment
summary: Chelsea striker Sam Kerr was found not guilty of causing racially aggravated harassment after calling a police officer "stupid and white". The incident occurred in Twickenham, South-West London, in January 2023. Kerr apologized for expressing herself poorly but maintained she did not intend to insult or harm anyone. The trial revealed attempts to get the case thrown out due to an abuse of process by crown prosecutors.

title: Man'S Pop-Up Urinal Death May Never Be Explained, Family Fears
summary: A maintenance engineer was killed in a freak accident in Soho while working on a pop-up urinal. His family is seeking answers about the cause of his death and expresses distress over the delay in the investigation. The incident occurred while working for Westminster City Council, and a Health and Safety Executive spokesperson is assisting the Metropolitan Police investigation.

title: 'When The Wind Blows At Grenfell, I Feel My Dad'
summary: The article discusses the personal impact of the Grenfell Tower fire, focusing on the emotional response of the author when the wind blows in the area.

title: 'I Have To Shower At The Gym' - Disabled People Wait For Simple Home Changes
summary: On a cold and wet evening, Sam Lewis walks to her local gym for a shower. It is a painful and slow journey, using a walking stick.The 34-year-old's rheumatoid arthritis means she risks falling when cl...

title: Over 100 E-Bikes Seized To Combat Pavement Blocking
summary: City of London Corporation seizes over 100 rental e-bikes obstructing pavements and roads, with companies able to collect their products after paying a fee. The corporation is committed to adding 300 additional parking spaces for e-bikes.

title: Runway Hopes Reignite Heathrow Southern Rail Plan
summary: Plans for a new railway connecting Heathrow to Surrey have resurfaced, aiming to increase connectivity and reduce surface emissions. The Heathrow Southern Railway (HSR) would operate between Heathrow and London Waterloo via Staines, with direct trains to Woking and Guildford. The project, privately financed and estimated to cut millions of road journeys, is backed by the government as part of its plans to boost the UK's economy.

title: Family 'Heartbroken' As Missing Sailor Named As London Father
summary: Family of British sailor, Charles Todd, mourns his death after his boat capsized off the south-west coast of France. Todd was a member of the Greenwich Yacht Club for over a decade.

title: London Vegan Restaurant To Get Michelin Star
summary: A vegan restaurant in Hackney, Plates London, has become the first vegan restaurant in the UK to receive a Michelin star. Nine restaurants in London received their first star, and two received a second star. The Ritz Restaurant in Westminster received two stars, and Soho's Humble Chicken received a second star. This year's ceremony was held as the Michelin Guide celebrates its 125th anniversary.

title: Woman Wins Â£95K Settlement After Moped Collision
summary: "Everything seems to have stopped, and my life is not the same any more."More than two years after being hit by a moped while on her way to a Mother's Day dinner with her sons in 2022, Loraine White f...

title: King Praises School Allergy Scheme After Teen Death
summary: King Charles supports a new allergy awareness program for schools, launched by the parents of a teen who died from a severe allergic reaction. The program aims to train teachers and staff to better understand and deal with food allergies, as many teachers have little food allergy awareness. The program will also provide educational films, first aid advice, and lesson plans.

title: Rape Accused Urged Victim To Drink Alcohol - Court
summary: A Chinese PhD student is accused of drugging and raping 10 women, including three in London. The alleged incidents occurred after the suspect encouraged the victims to drink alcohol. The trial is ongoing.

title: Man Denies Murdering His Six-Year-Old Daughter
summary: A father from Camden, London is on trial for the murder of his six-year-old daughter, who suffered serious injuries when she was eight weeks old. The father, Kyle Kitchen, has denied the charges. The mother, Kenzey Kane, was found guilty of causing or allowing serious injury to a child. Their daughter died from her injuries in 2021.

title: Un Concern After Activists Accused Of Terror Laws Link
summary: The UN has expressed concern over the detention of activists under anti-terrorism laws. The activists are accused of damaging property at a facility allegedly supplying arms to Israel. They were denied legal support, family visits, and healthcare. The Home Office stated there is sufficient evidence of a terrorism connection. The UN has raised concerns about potential human rights violations during their detention.

title: Chelsea Star Sam Kerr Cleared Of Racial Harassment
summary: Chelsea striker Sam Kerr has been found not guilty of causing racially aggravated harassment, after calling a Metropolitan Police officer "stupid and white".A jury at Kingston Crown Court cleared her ...

title: Policing In 'Hopeless Position' After Court Ruling On Vetting, Met Chief Says
summary: The High Court ruled that an officer accused of rape cannot be dismissed due to an unfair vetting process, leaving the Metropolitan Police in a "hopeless position". The officer, who denied the allegations, cannot be trusted to work with women or enter the homes of vulnerable people. The ruling has major implications for the ability of police chiefs to sack officers and is a blow to the Met's pledge to root out unfit individuals. The force plans to appeal the decision.

title: London To Get New 33-Storey Offices With Food Venues, Pop-Up Market And Public Viewing Gallery
summary: Plans for a 33-story office block at 70 Gracechurch Street in the City of London have been approved, with substantial elements of the existing structure retained. The development includes food and drink spots, a public viewing gallery, and a pop-up market. The project is expected to deliver a world-class, sustainable office development, enhancing the eastern cluster and creating a vibrant new gateway to Leadenhall Market.

title: âI Was Slapped With A Â£625 Ulez Charge Even Though I Drive An Electric Car'
summary: A London grandad was charged Â£625 for emissions even though he drives an electric car. The man from Hampton, near the ULEZ zone, was given a personalized number plate for his electric MG ZS ride by his children. He was charged for both the Low Emission Zone (LEZ) and Ultra Low Emission Zone (ULEZ) due to a mistake from a previous owner who might have operated a commercial vehicle across the Irish Sea. TfL has since refunded the charges.

title: Met Police Detective Who Appeared In Bbc Rape Documentary Made Rape Threats To Partners, Tribunal Told
summary: A Metropolitan Police detective, who worked at a unit investigating sex offences, abused, harassed, and made rape threats to former partners, a tribunal heard. Detective Constable David Fall, who work...

title: Construction Of Step-Free Access Resumes At West London Station After Being Halted 5 Years Ago
summary: Construction of step-free access has resumed at Northolt Station in Hillingdon, with a new footbridge, left, and boarding ramps to improve accessibility. The project is part of wider work to add step-free stations on the TfL network, with station staff present during construction. The public toilets will close in April 2025, and the work is expected to be completed in Summer 2026.

title: Woman, 27, Named As Victim Of Clapton Crash After Car Hit Bus
summary: A 27-year-old woman, Soriah Berry, died after her car collided with a bus in Clapton, Hackney. The incident occurred near the junction of Lea Bridge Road and Clapton Road. The Metropolitan Police and Transport for London are investigating the crash.

title: 43 North London Streets Identified For Lime Bike Docking Bays To Tidy Up Streets - Full List
summary: Brent Council is identifying priority locations for new Lime bike docking stations, following threats to remove Lime bikes due to safety concerns. Lime will invest in new docking stations and reduce its fleet from 750 to 500. The first round of consultations involves 43 locations, predominantly in the Kilburn area. Lime also announced a Â£20m London Action Plan to tackle issues with e-bike parking across the city.

title: Tfl Paid Out More Than Â£250K In Injury Claims On The London Underground Last Year
summary: Transport for London paid over Â£250,000 in injury claims on the London Underground in the year ending April 2024. The highest claims were for Â£82,635, Â£55,000, and Â£37,500. Six claims were made for incidents relating to train doors, totaling Â£17,490. A passenger received Â£7,500 for an injury in a lift, and two claims were made for injuries from ticket barriers. No claims were made for incidents involving the gap between Tube trains and the platform.

title: Shoppers Say 'No Need For Botox' Thanks To No7 Anti-Ageing Cream - Now Â£10 At Boots
summary:
Boots shoppers are praising a night cream that leaves skin looking younger. And not only does it have great reviews, it's also been discounted as part of the retailer's 'Â£10 Tuesday'.
For one day only...

title: Amazon Knocks Â£84 Off 'Excellent' Tefal Non-Stick Pan Set That 'Heats Quickly And Cooks Evenly'
summary: Amazon has discounted Tefal's Induction Non-Stick Cookware Set by Â£84, making it more affordable than at Argos. The set includes two frying pans and three saucepans with glass lids, and is suitable for all hobs. Some customers have reported issues with the non-stick coating. Alternative options are available from Lakeland and John Lewis.

title: Teenagers Admit Starting Fire That Killed Pensioner, 76, In His East London Home
summary: Two teenagers pleaded guilty to manslaughter after starting a fire that killed a 76-year-old man in his home in Dagenham, Barking and Dagenham. The teenagers were previously charged with murder and arson, but the Crown Prosecution Service accepted pleas to the lesser charge of manslaughter. The sentencing will take place on April 25.

title: Belvedere Brute Tore Off 'Large Piece' Of Stranger'S Ear During Unprovoked Attack
summary: A man from Belvedere, Greenwich, was jailed for over 7 years for an unprovoked attack on a stranger, tearing off a piece of his ear. The victim was on the phone with his children and sought to avoid confrontation. The assault has had a significant impact on the victim.

title: London Man Arrested Amid Brothel Busting Operation In Barnet
summary: A man from North London was arrested for suspected involvement in a brothel busting operation in Barnet. The operation was carried out by the Modern Slavery and Human Trafficking Unit at Hertfordshire Police. Multiple foreign national women were found at the location and offered help with safeguarding concerns. The operation was intelligence-led and aimed to raise awareness of signs of exploitation.

title: Ex-Met Police Officer Would Have Been Dismissed For Abusing And Harassing Seven Women
summary: A Met Police officer has been dismissed after he was accused of domestic abuse and harassment by seven different women he was in a relationship with. Former Detective Constable (DC) David Fall was acc...

title: Inside The Eerie South London Estate That Was Left Abandoned For Almost 10 Years
summary: An abandoned estate, Maryon Grove in Greenwich, stood empty for almost 10 years before demolition in 2023. The 16-block, 172-home estate was left in decay, filled with leftover furniture and personal items, resembling Chernobyl's abandoned housing blocks. Lovell Homes plans to present new site plans between late 2024 and early 2025.

title: Chelsea Striker Sam Kerr Cleared Of Racially Harassing Met Police Officer
summary: Chelsea striker Sam Kerr was cleared of causing racially aggravated harassment after calling a Metropolitan Police officer "stupid and white". The incident occurred in south-west London in January 2023. Kerr and her partner, Kristie Mewis, were out drinking and were driven to Twickenham Police Station by a taxi driver who complained about clean-up costs and a smashed rear window. Kerr became abusive towards Pc Stephen Lovell, leading to her arrest. The court heard that Kerr felt dismissed and racially targeted by the police. The Crown Prosecution Service initially decided not to charge Kerr, but her legal team attempted to get the case thrown out, arguing there had been an abuse of process.

title: London Street Could Become Monument To Lgbtq+ Rights In Memory Of Men Executed For Being Gay
summary: A Southwark politician is working with local groups to bid for cash for a rainbow plaque commemorating the last two men executed for sodomy in England. The plaque would be erected on Blackfriars Road, where the men were arrested. Southwark has a significant LGBT+ population, with 8.1% of residents identifying as LGB+.

title: Giant 34-Storey South London Tower With 147 Flats Could Be Built Next To London Heliport By Thames
summary: A developer plans to build a 34-story tower with 147 flats near London Heliport in Wandsworth. The tower would replace an empty office building and industrial garages, and would include affordable housing. The developer seeks public feedback and promises improvements to the area.

title: Kate Middleton Defended By Kensington Palace In Rare Statement
summary: Kensington Palace issued a statement denying changes to their policy of sharing information about Princess Kate's outfits, following criticism that media coverage of her fashion choices overshadows her charitable work. The Princess reportedly finds it frustrating when the focus shifts to her appearance instead of her charity endeavors. She has been known to boost sales and endorsements for the fashion industry.

title: First Photos Of Hanwell Murder Scene After Stab Victim Bleeds To Death Outside House
summary: A stabbing incident occurred in Hanwell, Ealing, resulting in a victim's death. The event had a negative impact on the local community.

title: West London Food Supplier Fined Â£9K For 'Potentially Life Threatening' Spices Imported From Pakistan
summary: A West London food importer and distributor has been fined for failing to ensure essential safety checks on potentially 'toxic food' it brought into the UK. The Southall based company failed council c...

title: M&S 'Moving Into Closed West London Whole Foods' After Shop Has Sat Empty For Months
summary: Former Whole Foods Market in Fulham Broadway, Hammersmith and Fulham will be taken over by Marks and Spencer, after being vacant since last summer. The announcement of Whole Foods Market closing the store was met with local consternation. The Broadway has seen several closures in recent years, but a new JD Wetherspoon is set to open.

title: Man, 60, Dragged Under London Bus Waited Over 2 Hours For Ambulance As Blood Poured From Arm
summary: A man dragged under a double decker bus when the driver pulled away without performing a final check waited more than two hours for an ambulance as his degloved and broken arm poured with blood, a cou...

title: 'I Tried Mcdonald'S Stormzy Meal - The Change In Ordering System Had Staff Turning Down Tips'
summary: A new McDonald's meal, the Stormzy Meal, was launched in Croydon, the artist's hometown. The meal consists of McNuggets, chips, a Sprite, and an apple pie or McFlurry. The ordering process was manual, leading to a noticeable community vibe and warm interactions between staff and customers. The meal will be available across the UK from February 12.

title: Eastenders Fans In Tears As Iconic Characters Return For One-Off Scene
summary: EastEnders fans felt nostalgic and emotional as a scene from the 1980s featuring the Fowler family was aired, paying tribute to the late actors Bill Treacher and Wendy Richard who played Arthur and Pauline Fowler.

title: First Picture Of Dagenham Gunmaker Who Converted Weapons Linked To Murders In His Garden Shed
summary: A man was sentenced to 10.5 years in prison for manufacturing firearms from Turkish-manufactured blank firers in his garden shed. These guns have been used in murders and are being converted using household tools. A national amnesty is underway to take as many of these guns off the streets as possible.
